problem_prompt:
Your job is to consider a number theory problem, and leave a plan for the next person to solve it. The problem will be revealed one sentence at a time. You do not have the entire problem yet, thus just do whatever calcluations/planning you think will be useful for the next person. If you don't think you can make any progress, say so. The following is a portion of the entire problem, and the work/progress/message the previous person left for you. There may be errors in the provided work that was previously done and left for you, so check and fix them if necessary.
It is now 12:00:00 midnight, as read on a 12-hour digital clock.In 122 hours, 39 minutes and 44 seconds the time will be $A:B:C$.
The previous person identified that the time on the clock is 12:00:00. 

Considering the time on a 12-hour digital clock, we know that every hour is divided into 60 minutes, so we have 60 minutes in total.
solution: Since the clock reads the same time every 12 hours, we find the remainder after dividing 122 hours by 12 hours, which is 2 hours. Counting forward from midnight, the clock will read 2:39:44, so $A+B+C = \boxed{85}$.
gpt_response:
The next step is to convert 122 hours to days in order to simplify the calculation. 

$122 \text{ hours} = \frac{122}{24} \approx 5.083 \text{ days}$

So we have a total of 5 days and 0.083 days, which is around 2 hours. 

Next, we convert 39 minutes to hours in order to add it to our total hours calculated earlier. 

$39 \text{ minutes} = \frac{39}{60} \approx 0.65 \text{ hours}$

Adding this to the 122 hours, we get a total of 122.65 hours.
